result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevon S. Reid was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevon S. Reid

records.addlTxt: 3:30 PM Room 301 Defendant Trevon S. Reid appeared by video in custody at Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Cana G Kohn appeared by video for Trevon S. Reid.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. All appearances by zoom. Defendant can hear and understand on zoom and consents to being present on zoom. State notes need waiver of preliminary hearing. Information and statement of uncharged read-ins filed. Courtesy copy of information emailed to atty Kohn. Information mirrored complaint. Plea agreement. State requests defendant plead ct. 1 - recommends 3 1/2 years, 18 mo initial confinement, 24 mo extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentence, court costs, DNA sample unless already provided, surcharge, complete any counseling deemed necessary by agent. Court reviews waiver of preliminary form. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver from defendant. Court finds probable cause. Binds case over and filing of information. Information emailed to defense. Defense reviewed information, waives reading. Court reviews plea questionnaire. Defendant plea no contest to sole count. Court advises defendant of constitutional rights. Defendant waives right to trial. Court reviews elements and penalties. Defendant enters plea freely. Court warns of possible deportation. Atty Kohn is satisfied. Court finds defendant enters plea freely and voluntarily. Court finds factual basis. Court accepts defendants plea. Court finds def guilty on ct. 1. Sentencing remarks by state. Sentencing remarks by defense. Remarks by defendant. Remarks by court. Court abides by recommendation. Court orders on ct. 1 - 3 1/2 years prison, 18 mo initial confinement, 24 mo extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentence, court costs, DNA sample unless already provided, $250 surcharge, complete any counseling or assessments deemed beneficial by agent. State advises court defendant not entitled to credit, not entitled to it as it is consecutive. Court finds 0 credit on this case. Court advises of firearm and voting restrictions. Court finds defendant is eligible for earned release and challenge incarceration program. No cash bond. Defense advises court on payment options but advises court defendant will not be able to make payments. Court advises defendant of payments on supervision or civil judgment. Defendant will make payments during extended supervision. Court orders that defendant will make payments on court costs during extended supervision. Court advises defendant of post conviction rights.
Information for Defendant after Felony Conviction Warning not to Possess firearms

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on September 27, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Trevon S. Reid
Current: 918 Townline Rd, Wausau, WI 54403 United States  (Effective: 07-05-2022)
Prior: 840 Clermont Street, Antigo, WI 54409

2:34 PM in Room 301. Defendant Trevon S. Reid appeared by phone, in custody at Langlade County Jail..  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Cana G Kohn appeared by phone for Trevon S. Reid. Court reviews charges. Def. on probation hold. Court requests $25,000 signature bond with standard conditions. Attny Kohn heard on bond, Def. is contesting revocation. Attny Kohn indicates that Def. wants to waive time limits. Further remarks by State, now requests $10,000 cash bond with standard conditions. Response by Attny Kohn. Court sets bond at $10,000 cash with standard conditions. Def.  has waived time limits. Court vacates warrant.
Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
